channel.title: Aww Crap.. Help me?
channel.description:
Ok. So the max level on my server [317 Delatascape] WAS 99 but i changed it to 126. I didnt change the max Exp. Its still 200m but If someone gets 99 of a skill it desplays as 126 instead of 99. Can someone aid this poor man? Any help is apreciated
-Thanks Zukyak

item.title: Aww Crap.. Help me?
item.dc:creator: @Zukyak Zukyak
item.description:
@Zukyak wrote:

Well Thanks a lot guys…
Once I changed

if (exp > 13034430)
return 126;

To

if (exp > 1 if (exp > 19999999)
return 125;

It worked… but shortly after I did some work to my client.java, my server suffered a severe crash…
Now it wont even login…
Thanks anyway

(3 months wasted… )

Read full topic

item.title: Aww Crap.. Help me?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) { int points = 0; int output = 0; if (exp >= 200000000) return 126; for (int lvl = 1; lvl < 126; lvl++) { points += Math.floor((double) lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0)); output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4); if (output >= exp) { return lvl; } } return 126;

Should work fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Aww Crap.. Help me?
item.dc:creator: @revengr revengr
item.description:
@revengr wrote:

I didn’t repost your code.

for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 126; lvl++) {

Was changed to

for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 125; lvl++) {

Instead of taking a quick look and assuming that its the same thing, maybe you should search a little more thoroughly, there isn’t a whole lot there to look at.

Read full topic

item.title: Aww Crap.. Help me?
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

[quote=“revengr, post:10, topic:319657”]If he doesnt want the players to get level 126 until 200M xp, then that wont work.

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) { int points = 0; int output = 0; if (exp > 199999999) return 126; for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 125; lvl++) { points += Math.floor((double) lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0)); output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4); if (output >= exp) { return lvl; } } return 126;[/quote]
why did u do a repost of my code? dipshit that will work but u gotta change the token. what u do is search 13034430 again after u change it and it will have another return; 99 again change those to the same format as the above and you will have 126/126 once you hit 199999999xp

Read full topic

item.title: Aww Crap.. Help me?
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) { int points = 0; int output = 0; if (exp > 199999999) return 126; for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 126; lvl++) { points += Math.floor((double) lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0)); output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4); if (output >= exp) { return lvl; } } return 126;

don’t forget to change the token as well or else u will end up with 126/99

item.title: Aww Crap.. Help me?
item.dc:creator: @Zukyak Zukyak
item.description:
@Zukyak wrote:

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;
if (exp > 13034430)
return 126;
for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 126; lvl++) {
points += Math.floor((double) lvl + 300.0
* Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0));
output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4);
if (output >= exp) {
return lvl;
}
}
return 126;

Thats the only thing I edited

Read full topic
